item.description:
Odiorne Point State Park offers one of the most beautiful natural settings along New Hampshire's 18-mile coastline.

Come with us to hike the beautiful Odiorne Point trails and visit The Seacoast Center at Odiorne Point State Park. The state park is a great place to explore with its 350-acres of hiking trails through multiple habitats. The Seacoast Science Center will take us deeper into those habitats with a tide pool touch-tank. There are also interpretive exhibits, a 32-foot skeleton of a humpback whale, amazing views of the seashore, a rare blue lobster in their "Gulf of Maine" exhibit hall and much more. This will be an opportunity to enjoy learning things you never knew about the coastline and all of its creatures.
We will start by hiking parts of the extensive network of trails that wind through the dense vegetation as they traverse the park. There are spectacular views of the ocean and the rocky shore.

 

We'll stop for lunch after the hike leaving plenty of time to be at our super bowl viewing location of choice (or maybe go somewhere together). Any ideas?

 

 

 

Pack a day pack (and bring); extra gloves, clothing, snacks, water, thermoses (of HOT; soup, coffee, hot chocolate, or whatever.

 

 

Wear boots & clothing suitable for the conditions that day. Layers are best, and crampons or micro spikes are suggested, snowshoes if there's a significant amount of new snow.

Meetup location is posted at the top!

Please, you must be a PAID UP member to join us.

Call me with any questions @ (603) 759-9876
item.how_to_find_us: Meet IN THE PARKING LOT at the Seacoast Science Center at 12:00 NOON. My (Dana's) cell # is (603) 759-9876

group.name: The Portsmouth "and beyond" Nite Out Meetup Group

item.name: Odiorne Point State Park - Hike/Snowshoe, explore, and Discover the Seacoast
